metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0194 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - high.
metadata.Description: [Netatalk ad_addcomment Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Netatalk. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the ad_addcomment function. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root.]
